intro: Kobresia nudicarpa, commonly known as the naked-fruited kobresia, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the cold, arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family, and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear its distinctive, naked fruits. It is well adapted to harsh environments, with a deep root system that helps it survive in nutrient-poor soils. Kobresia nudicarpa plays an important role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various alpine and arctic organisms.
